chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: NormedModule K

Goal:
forall (f : K -> K) (x : K) (k : V), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive (fun x0 : K => scal (f x0) k) x

Premises:
scal = fun (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K) => ModuleSpace.scal K (AbelianGroup.Pack V (ModuleSpace.class K V) V) (ModuleSpace.class K V) : forall (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K), K -> V -> V Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted
f = fun f : family => let (ind, f0, _) := f in f0 : family -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ R_scope R_scope] f is a coercion
ex_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) => exists l : V, is_derive f x l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule.type
is_derive_scal_l : forall (f : K -> K) (x l : K) (k : V), is_derive f x l -> is_derive (fun x0 : K => scal (f x0) k) x (scal l k)
ex_derive_scal : forall (f : R -> R) (k x : R), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive (fun x0 : R => k * f x0) x
Derive_plus : forall (f g : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x -> Derive (fun x0 : R => f x0 + g x0) x = Derive f x + Derive g x
Derive_minus : forall (f g : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x -> Derive (fun x0 : R => f x0 - g x0) x = Derive f x - Derive g x
ex_derive_plus : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x -> ex_derive (fun x0 : ?K => plus (f x0) (g x0)) x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_minus : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x -> ex_derive (fun x0 : ?K => minus (f x0) (g x0)) x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_sum_n : forall (f : nat -> ?K -> ?V) (n : nat) (x : ?K), (forall k : nat, (k <= n)%nat -> ex_derive (f k) x) -> ex_derive (fun y : ?K => sum_n (fun k : nat => f k y) n) x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_opp : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive (fun x0 : ?K => opp (f x0)) x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_inv : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), ex_derive f x -> f x <> 0 -> ex_derive (fun y : R => / f y) x
is_derive_scal : forall (f : R -> R) (x k df : R), is_derive f x df -> is_derive (fun x0 : R => k * f x0) x (k * df)
ex_derive_Reals_1 : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), derivable_pt f x -> ex_derive f x
ex_derive_ext_loc : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), locally x (fun t : ?K => f t = g t) -> ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
Derive_correct : forall (f : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive f x -> is_derive f x (Derive f x)
continuous_scal_l : forall (f : ?U -> ?K) (k : ?V) (x : ?U), continuous f x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => scal (f y) k) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_ext : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), (forall t : ?K, f t = g t) -> ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) (l : V) => filterdiff f (locally x) (fun y : K => scal y l) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> V -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _ _]
ex_derive_continuous : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x -> continuous f x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
continuous_scal : forall (k : ?U -> ?K) (f : ?U -> ?V) (x : ?U), continuous k x -> continuous f x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => scal (k y) (f y)) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_derive_plus : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (df dg : ?V), is_derive f x df -> is_derive g x dg -> is_derive (fun x0 : ?K => plus (f x0) (g x0)) x (plus df dg) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_derive_minus : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (df dg : ?V), is_derive f x df -> is_derive g x dg -> is_derive (fun x0 : ?K => minus (f x0) (g x0)) x (minus df dg) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_filterdiff : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x < -> ex_filterdiff f (locally x) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
continuous_scal_r : forall (k : ?K) (f : ?U -> ?V) (x : ?U), continuous f x -> continuous (fun y : ?U => scal k (f y)) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
continuous_comp : forall (f : ?U -> ?V) (g : ?V -> ?W) (x : ?U), continuous f x -> continuous g (f x) -> continuous (fun x0 : ?U => g (f x0)) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- UniformSpace] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- UniformSpace] ?W : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- UniformSpace]
NormedModule.ax2 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (l : K) (x : V), NormedModule.norm K V m (scal l x) <= abs l * NormedModule.norm K V m x
is_derive_opp : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (l : ?V), is_derive f x l -> is_derive (fun x0 : ?K => opp (f x0)) x (opp l) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
filterdiff_scal_r_fct : forall (k : ?K) (f lf : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> filterdiff f ?F lf -> filterdiff (fun x : ?U => scal k (f x)) ?F (fun x : ?U => scal k (lf x)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
mult = fun K : Ring => Ring.mult (AbelianGroup.Pack K (Ring.class K) K) (Ring.class K) : forall K : Ring, K -> K -> K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
filter_prod_proper = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (F : (T1 -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (T2 -> Prop) -> Prop) (FF : ProperFilter F) (FG : ProperFilter G) => {| filter_ex := fun (P : T1 * T2 -> Prop) (H : filter_prod F G P) => match H with | @Filter_prod _ _ _ _ _ Q1 Q2 H1 H2 HP => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (x : T1) (p : (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x), (fun _ : exists x0 : T1, Q1 x0 => exists x0 : T1 * T2, P x0) (ex_intro (fun x0 : T1 => Q1 x0) x p) => match filter_ex Q1 H1 as e return ((fun _ : exists x : T1, Q1 x => exists x : T1 * T2,...
ex_filterdiff_scal_r_fct : forall (k : ?K) (f : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> ex_filterdiff f ?F -> ex_filterdiff (fun x : ?U => scal k (f x)) ?F where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
is_equiv = fun (T : Type) (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (f g : T -> V) => is_domin F g (fun x : T => minus (g x) (f x)) : forall (T : Type) (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> (T -> V) -> (T -> V) -> Prop Arguments T, K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope]
